summary: This is an email exchange between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York discussing a 5K letter for an inmate. The correspondence indicates the inmate's account was not relied upon for charging their case and is unlikely to be called as a witness, but will be important background for an OIG report.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the email discussing a 5K letter and inquiring about an inmate's potential role as a witness.

events.title: Email discussion about 5K letter and inmate witness
events.description: Prosecutors in the Southern District of New York exchange emails regarding a 5K letter for an inmate, discussing whether the inmate was critical to charging their case and if they might be needed as a witness.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: Prosecutors confirmed they did not rely on any inmates in charging their case.
It is highly unlikely any inmate will be called as a witness in the case.
An inmate's account is expected to be important background for an upcoming OIG report.
The email discusses preparation of a 5K letter for submission to Probation.
The correspondence reveals internal prosecutorial discussions about witness utility and case background.
